result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brysin M McKinney

records.addlTxt: No appearance by Defense counsel at scheduled hearing time.  Attorney Patrickus contacted the court and requested adjourned plea hearing to allow time to meet with the Defendant who is in custody.  Matter rescheduled to 12/2/2022 at 9:30 am for plea hearing. Defendant to appear via zoom from RCI.
Facility unable to produce Defendant via zoom for 10/19/2022 at 2:00 pm plea date.  Matter reset to 10/18/2022 at 10:00 am.  Defendant to appear via zoom from RCI.
Request from Counsel to adjourn Plea hearing;  Case reset from 9/13/2022 at 2:30 pm to 10/19/2022 at 2:00 pm.  Defendant to appear via zoom from RCI.

Defendant Brysin M McKinney in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Defendant Brysin M McKinney in custody, produced.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for Attorney Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests plea hearing date be scheduled.  State to submit order to produce.
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court, defendant Brysin M McKinney not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 as the deadline for the State to confirm that all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, be turned over to the Defense. Court sets 08/01/2022 as the deadline to file any motions, change of plea forms and/or a written notice for requesting the defendant to appear via zoom. State to complete an order to produce.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brysin M McKinney in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appear by video.  Defendant Brysin M McKinney in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046463,
Payable Number: 1006535,
Receipt Number: 22RP019497,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Brysin M McKinney
Current: 9015 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-06-2022)
Prior: 9015 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Brysin M McKinney in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent for intake purposes.  Defendant Brysin M McKinney in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brysin M McKinney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT, retained private counsel.  State request to be heard on bail at Preliminary Hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
